@description.name: @description
@description.body: Static helpers for parsing and modifying URIs.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Split URL

Code taken from:
parseUri 1.2.2
(c) Steven Levithan <stevenlevithan.com>
MIT License

@param.name: @param
@param.body: str {String} String to parse as URI

@param.name: @param
@param.body: strict {Boolean} Whether to parse strictly by the rules
@param.description: Whether to parse strictly by the rules

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Map with parts of URI as properties
@return.description: Map with parts of URI as properties

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Append string to query part of URL. Respects existing query.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: url {String} URL to append string to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: params {String} Parameters to append to URL.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} URL with string appended in query part.
@return.description: URL with string appended in query part.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Serializes an object to URI parameters (also known as query string).

Escapes characters that have a special meaning in URIs as well as
umlauts. Uses the global function encodeURIComponent, see
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/encodeURIComponent

Note: For URI parameters that are to be sent as
application/x-www-form-urlencoded (POST), spaces should be encoded
with "+".

@param.name: @param
@param.body: post {Boolean} Whether spaces should be encoded with "+".
@param.description: Whether spaces should be encoded with "+".

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String}      Serialized object. Safe to append to URIs or send as
URL encoded string.
@return.description:
Serialized object. Safe to append to URIs or send as
URL encoded string.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Encodes key/value to URI safe string and pushes to given array.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: post {Boolean} Whether spaces should be encoded with "+".
@param.description: Whether spaces should be encoded with "+".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Takes a relative URI and returns an absolute one.
